title: Worked Solution
text:
To solve this equation, we need to get all of the terms with $$p$$ on one side and all of the constants on the other side.
First, let's start by combining like terms on each side:
$$6(p-3)-7=5\left(4p+3ight)-12$$
$$6p-18-7=20p+15-12$$
Next, let's move all of the $$p$$ terms to the left side and all of the constants to the right side:
$$6p-7-18=20p-12+15$$
Finally, let's combine the like terms:
$$6p-25=20p+3$$
Now we can solve for $$p$$ by subtracting $$6p$$ from both sides and adding $$25$$ to both sides:
$$-14p=28$$
To solve for $$p$$, we divide both sides by -14:
$$p=-2$$
Therefore, the solution to the equation is $$p=-2$$.
